title: Web Development Intern
requirements:
We're?currently hiring for Web Development Interns to join our teams remotely in Summer 2021.?? As a Web Development Intern, you will:??? + Develop and implement digital technology solutions with appropriate software design methodology in a dynamic and fast paced team environment?? + Partner with the team to perform all phases of the software development life cycle including requirements analysis, application design, code development and testing and client interaction?? + Work with modern DevOps tooling including Infrastructure as Code, Configuration Management, and CI/CD + Write automated unit, integration, and end-to-end tests that run in mature CI/CD pipelines + Troubleshoot production support issues post-deployment and create solutions as required?? + Assist in creation of technical documentation as part of client deliverables?? + Collaborate and work in an agile team environment?? As a Web Development Intern, you will have:??? + An ability to define and present conceptual technology solutions to both technical and non-technical clients while articulating the value of technology to drive creative marketing platforms?? + The ability to translate client goals into achievable technical specifications?? + Experience with hands-on development, including an understanding of applications architecture such as:?? + Object-oriented design and design patterns?? + ORM libraries?? + Database diagramming?? + Systems diagramming? + Cloud native engineering + Serverless and microservice based solutions + Experience with technology skills including:?? + Java, C#/.

NET, TS/JS or equivalent?? + One SQL database technology (MySQL, MSSQL, Oracle or equivalent)?? + HTML, CSS,?Javascript, JSP + Angular, React, Vue + AWS, Azure + Experience with source control: Git and/or SVN?? + Ability to integrate RESTful web services?? + Agile software development via SCRUM or Kanban + GitHub page or code sample preferred?? Basic Qualifications:?? + Working towards a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Management Information Systems, Mathematics, or?related field?? title: Web Development Internship
requirements:
Overdrive Interactive is a Boston-based digital agency with a unique blend of strategic, media, creative and technical services that truly represent the model of what most agencies are striving to become in today's competitive environment. Employment at Overdrive means having the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment providing some of the world's leading companies with the cutting edge online marketing programs they need to succeed and grow. Our team members get their heads around online advertising, search marketing, social media, mobile, digital creative, analytics and more – all the things marketing and creative professionals need experience in to thrive in today's ever changing marketplace. Want to know more? Check out our site at www.overdriveinteractive.com

An internship at Overdrive Interactive is a foot in the door. We train our interns to become expert interactive marketers so they can work for our company. So, while getting in the door might be a little harder here once you're in, you are viewed as a critical team member and an integral part of the agency's future. The Intern's duties will encompass all aspects of web development, from start-up (design, functionality, coding, mark-up writing, and testing) to routine maintenance and troubleshooting.

Responsibilities:
• Provide daily development support for the Marketing Department.
• Conduct development research for clients, as needed.
• Work with database systems including MySQL.
• Work with off-the-shelf and open source CMS systems such as SharePoint, Drupal and WordPress.
• Work on projects including web layout enhancements, desktop applications, website enhancements, web-based applications, and database-backed websites.
• Test company websites with multiple browsers in order to maximize traffic capabilities.

Requirements:
• Senior undergraduate currently enrolled in a college or university.
• Knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
• Understanding of cross-browser issues and W3C standards.
• Knowledge of PHP programming language.
• Excellent attention to detail.
• Self-motivated to explore new technologies and programs.
• Ability to work efficiently, both independently and in team environments.
• Able to devote 15-20 hours per week at Overdrive.
• Education and experience industry standards in website development and content accessibility.
• Analytical, creative and willing to experiment.
• Ability to deal with uncertainty.
Hours can be flexible to work around a school schedule for the ideal individual. This is an unpaid internship for college credit and experience to transition onboard full-time

title: Web Developer Intern
requirements:
Applied Dynamic Solutions, LLC, a technical web design agency based in Rahway, NJ, is looking to hire a web developer intern. The candidate should be detail-oriented, a team-player, and have the ability to work independently on multiple projects simultaneously.

The ideal candidate will have experience with HTML and CSS:
• Ability to code HTML pages and make copy changes within existing code
• Style pages in a separate CSS file to affect a change to the page in a browser, using element, class and ID selectors.

Required:
• Coding valid HTML and CSS Cross-browser compatibility
• Basic UX and Designability Strong interpersonal communication skills

Opportunity to Learn (Not required):
• CSS3, HTML5 (PLUS)
• Twitter Bootstrap (MAJOR plus)
• Responsive Web Design CSS Preprocessor (LESS Dynamic Stylesheets)
• Web frameworks (Bootstrap, AngularJS, MVC Design Pattern in Visual Studio)
• JavaScript/jQuery Web standards Source Code Control (Git/GitHub, TFS)
• SEO/Google Analytics

Minimum 15-20hrs/week commitment.
Possible part-time hiring based on skill level.
We offer work-for-credit and stipend.

For more information, send an email to info@adsworks.com

title: Internship: SOLIDWORKS- Web Developer -Flexible Start date 2021
requirements: Imagine New HorizonsBe at the forefront of innovation! Serving customers of all sizes, in all industries from high-tech, life sciences, construction and transportation, we help businesses and people around the world create products and services in a novel, sustainable way.Do you have dreams? Do you enjoy a challenge? Here at Dassault Systèmes, we empower people with passion to change the world. Shape your career with 3DS! #WeAre3DSWhat your role will be?As a Web Development Intern you will work within the Documentation team for the SOLIDWORKS organization. The Documentation team authors and produces all SOLIDWORKS documentation. In this position, the Web Developer Intern will also work closely with the SOLIDWORKS Web Applications team.The Challenges Ahead...As a Web Development Intern your primary tasks will be:Completing work on a prototype web app started by a previous intern. This is a modern redesign of our online What’s New documentation. The finished app will be 100% production ready. Includes thoroughly documenting how to build, deploy, and maintain the app.Implementing a specification for a modern responsive redesign of our two main online help domainsWorking with the User Assistance manager to develop ideas and prototypes for next-generation versions of older UA deliverablesAssisting as necessary with other UA review and production tasks Your Key Success Factors…Experience in React, Express, and PostgreSQLExperience in core web technologies - HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PythonKnowledge of CAD and mechanical engineering concepts, or any experience using SOLIDWORKS or competitor CAD products, is a plus.Experience with ASP.NET, Visual Studio, and SQL Server a definite plusHighly organized with critical attention to details.Ability to work independently and within a collaborative team structure.Positive, self-motivated individual with a high level of enthusiasm and willingness to learn and incorporate coaching and instructions into daily tasks and assignments.Ability and willingness to rapidly self-teach new tools and technologies.Strong communication skillsBe in the know…Actively enrolled in a Bachelor or Master program at a college or university for the duration of the internship majoring in Computer Science, Web Development, or similar area of study for the duration of the internship.A minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0Work onsite at the Waltham, MA office locationAbility to shift directions quickly when priorities changeExcellent communication skills in English, both verbally and in writingAbility to work onsite for the duration of the internship

title: Front End Developer Intern
requirements:
Position: Front End Developer Intern, Boston

Duration: 2-6 Months (Part/Full-time)

Description of Company:

PartRunner is a new Boston-based startup that is revolutionizing how logistics are done in the Trades, Construction, Service, and Wholesale Distribution Industries. We are a B2B on-demand delivery service and leverage a network of independent drivers that have all types of vehicles; from small cars to 24ft Box Trucks. Our platform allows companies to request, manage and track all deliveries.

Our mission is to help companies in their logistics and supply chain efforts to allow them to work more efficiently while at the same time reducing costs.

Position Overview:

We’re looking for an extremely dedicated intern to join our team and take accountability of our branding, UI/UX, and other design projects within Movley. You will own your own projects and have direct control over large initiatives within the company. You will also have direct exposure to operations, software development, customers, and the business processes that make PartRunner run and will gain a considerable amount of experience on how different aspects of the business are conjoined to build something from the ground up.

Requirements:

• Knowledge of UNIX/Linux work environments

• Knowledge of standard web technology (HTTP, HTTPS, HTML5, client/server model)

• Solid understanding of JS like angular 8, react and redux

• Experience with git and the Gitlow workflow.

• JavaScript development beyond jQuery.

This will be a remotely administered internship with an immediate starting date upon hire. We will be able to accommodate different schedules and time zones including your academic calendar. In this role you will receive considerable levels of autonomy and ownership over your projects. Due to current market conditions, there will not be any compensation. We will be happy to provide recommendation letters, references, and resume items for your time at PartRunner

Qualification:

• Bachelor’s in Computer Science or similar

• Entrepreneurial minded and self-driven

• 3-6 Months of Sales or Customer Success Experience

• Have some knowledge in the Trades or Construction Industry

• Available to work remotely if required

Be part of an exciting team and have the opportunity to be involved with a Boston startup!

PartRunner focuses on Transportation, Construction, B2B Express Delivery, Electrical Distribution, and Hvac. Their company has offices in Boston and Massachusetts. They have a small team that's between 1-10 employees. To date, PartRunner has raised $300K of funding; their latest round was closed on February 2020 at a valuation of $2.5M.

You can view their website at https://www.partrunner.com or find them on Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn

title: Web design intern
requirements:
Company Description

Treehouse Strategy, a New York-based software startup is looking for a front-end web designer. This is an unpaid internship position.

Job Description

You are someone who has both artistic design sensibilities as well as technical front-end development skills. This combines design artistry with software engineering. We are looking for an intern to:
• Familiarity or experience with front-end frameworks such as React
• Ability to draw/create wireframes to map out user experience
• Artistic and strong sense of design
• Familiarity with CSS, Javascript, and Bootstrap to help design front-end of web applications
• Implement websites in CMS including WordPress and other front-end frameworks
• This position is available in either part- or fulltime.
• Can start immediately

This internship position is unpaid. In your cover letter, please specify your availability and include links to your portfolio and Github profile. Remote is acceptable.

Qualifications

Pursuing an undergraduate degree in design, web development, computer science, computer engineering, or a relevant field

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines
